channel.title: TotalArt.tv Podcast
channel.description:
The TotalArt Creative Insights podcast videos are Art for The People. We cover active artists from the fine arts to street art, in the visual, written and performing arts, including podcasting.

Every painting, sculpture, song, book, event or performance has 2 sides - what you see, hear and feel, and what the artists and directors were thinking about as they developed their work. Initially the podcasts will appear every other week and may be interviews or coverage of exhibitions or performances. Join us to explore creative minds at work.

If it’s art than we’ve got it covered.
channel.itunes:author: Robert Medrala & Becky Winant
channel.itunes:subtitle: The TotalArt Creative Insights podcast videos are Art for The People. We cover active artists from the fine arts to street art, in the visual, written and performing arts, including podcasting. Every painting, sculpture, song, book, event or perf

item.title: TotalArt.tv #14 - Na' rimbo
item.description: Na'rimbo recorded live at the 2009 Riviere Maya Jazz Festival. Na'rimbo was founded in 1998 by young marimba players who studied the contemporary and classical techniques of the instrument and have a strong grounding in the traditions of marimba music in the state of Chiapas, known as the Land of the Marimba, in southeastern Mexico. Under the leadership of Israel Moreno, the group has performed in several national and international festivals to the acclaim of critics and music lovers and has won many awards and prizes. Na'rimbo showcases unique fusions of traditional jazz instruments to create a sound where folk music, latin rhythms and jazz styles meet in an explosion of extraordinary percussion music. For centuries the marimba has played a fundamental role in life in Chiapas and many talented marimba builders have become gifted players. In Chiapas, the marimba is much more than a musical instrument. It is a cultural symbol that unites and identifies the people of this land with a tradition that has envolved from profound artistic roots as part of an artisan and musical expression shared by all. Na'rimbo seeks to show the world another side of mexican folklore and to promote the traditional culture and music of the southeastern regions.

item.title: TotalArt.tv #13 - Aguamala
item.description:
Aguamala recorded live at the 2009 Riviera Maya Jazz Festival in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. Aguamala was born in Playa del Carmen Mexico in February 2004, the band is integrated by Fernando Toussaint (drums), Enrique Pat (keyboards), Bernardo Ron (guitar) and Luis Ernesto Lopez (bass). A fine mix of influences, a base of jazz with touches of funk and rock, all that giving a particular sound to Aguamala.

In its six year history the band has had the participation of musicians and singers such as Caro Montes, Christian Beck, Natalia La Fourcade, Eugenio Toussaint, Diego Maroto, Dirk Freymuth, Mark Anderson and Sabo Romo among others.

Aguamala has been presented at several international forums and has become the host group in the Riviera Maya Jazz Festival, giving them the opportunity to share the stage with music icons such as Marcus Miller, Gino Vannelli, Screaming Headless Torsos, Tom Custer, Tower of Power, George Benson, David Sanborn, Kool And The Gang, George Duke, Ivan Lins, Caribbean Jazz Project and Mint Condition, among others.

Aguamala is hard to classify and the band members are just instruments without rules to follow just trying to capture and interpret with respect a small part of the infinite amount of music that is in the air. Now "13:20" their new album, a technically impeccable work, with the precision demanded by the genre and above all, with their heart in every single note.

With this new album Aguamala, is now reaching very important music forums in México and not only for Jazz but also of Mexican Rock, being invited for the first time to one of the most important Rock Festivals The "Vive Latino" 2010 in Mexico City.

In its six year history the band has had the participation of musicians and singers such as Caro Montes, Christian Beck, Natalia La Fourcade, Eugenio Toussaint, Diego Maroto, Dirk Freymuth, Mark Anderson and Sabo Romo among others. Aguamala has been presented at several international forums and has become the host group in the Riviera Maya Jazz Festival, giving them the opportunity to share the stage with music icons such as Marcus Miller, Gino Vannelli, Screaming Headless Torsos, Tom Custer, Tower of Power, George Benson, David Sanborn, Kool And The Gang, George Duke, Ivan Lins, Caribbean Jazz Project and Mint Condition, among others. Aguamala is hard to classify and the band members are just instruments without rules to follow just trying to capture and interpret with respect a small part of the infinite amount of music that is in the air. Now "13:20" their new album, a technically impeccable work, with the precision demanded by the genre and above all, with their heart in every single note. item.title: TotalArt.tv #12 - We're Back
item.description: Robert Medrala discusses what’s been going on in 2010 for TotalArt.tv and what to expect in 2011 and beyond.
item.itunes:subtitle: Robert Medrala discusses what’s been going on in 2010 for TotalArt.tv and what to expect in 2011 and beyond.
item.itunes:summary: Robert Medrala discusses what’s been going on in 2010 for TotalArt.tv and what to expect in 2011 and beyond.

item.title: TotalArt.tv #11 - bello benischauer Part 2
item.description:
bello benischauer, co-founder of ART IN PROCESS

Born 1966 in Krems/Austria bello currently lives and works in Fremantle/Western Australia. After becoming Master in the Trades of Locksmith, Blacksmith and Master of Welding Engineering he decided to travel the world and spent ten years in countries like South and Central America, Pakistan, Iran, Nepal, South and East Africa, Indonesia, New Zealand, India and Australia, today resulting in a deep connection to world- cultures in general.

Since the age of 18 he more and more became interested in artistic techniques and started to finally set his focus on new media and especially audio-visual installations combining word, vision and sound. Developing this practice through artistic partnerships around the world and self-thought methods he developed his own language that today is presented through numerous installations and projects that aim for a critical social engagement with his audience on different levels.

He has exhibited and worked on an international scale. In 2000 he received his double-Citizenship (Austria and Australia) and co-founded the artistic partnership ART IN PROCESS together with elisabeth m eitelberger. Both have been working independently under this partnership since and explore relationships between humanity, technology and the natural environment through a synthesis of various art practices, mainly resulting in audio-visual installations. All digital work by ART IN PROCESS on DVDs and Blu-Ray Discs is distributed by Contemporary Arts Media, Melbourne (www.artfilms.com.au) - one of the leading consultants and suppliers of films and books for Arts Education.

www.artinprocess.com

For a listing of bello’s works and shows see the TotalArt.tv blog.
